content.description:
Ding Guanpeng, Chinese Painter Employed by the Qing Court, Portrait of Emperor Qianlong as the Bodhisattva Manjusri, circa 1765

Freer Gallery of Art, Smithsonian Institution, Washington, D.C.: Purchase â€” Charles Lang Freer

The emperor is dressed as a Tibetan Buddhist teacher (lama). The Bodhisattva Manjusri is a major figure worshiped in the Tibetan Buddhist religious tradition.
content.question: Which of the following is an example of a religious policy most similar to the one represented by the painting?

choices.label: Spanish colonial authorities forcing the conversion of Native Americans to Christianity
Mughal rulers sponsoring Hindu learning and conversing with Hindu preachers
Merchants and Sufi mystics helping to spread Islam into Southeast Asia and sub-Saharan Africa
European rulers participating in religious wars during the Protestant Reformation

content.answer: Mughal rulers sponsoring Hindu learning and conversing with Hindu preachers
